attributes.text: Places the object according to the target. If parts of the object are outside of the axis’ range the object’s start is adjusted so that the overlap between the object and the axis is maximized.

Computes the start of the object by taking only the attachment and alignment into account. The object by be not fully visible.

Size of the object to align

Location of the object to align the object to. This map should have the keys start and end.

Map with all offsets on each side. Comes with the keys start and end.

Accepts the same values as the position argument of {@link #computeStart}.

The computed start position of the object.

Whether the object specified by start and size is completely inside of the axis’ range..

Computed start position of the object

Size of the object

The size of the axis

Whether the object is inside of the axis’ range
Location of the object to align the object to. This map should have the keys start and end.
Map with all offsets on each side. Comes with the keys start and end.

Alignment of the object on the target. Valid values are

  • edge-start The object is placed before the target
  • edge-end The object is placed after the target
  • align-startThe start of the object is aligned with the start of the target
  • align-centerThe center of the object is aligned with the center of the target
  • align-endThe end of the object is aligned with the end of the object
Computes the start of the object on the axis
The computed start position of the object.
